data.title: Good food; stone faces
data.text: I went to downtown Baltimore for  some errands and found this place. The buffet seems well supplied, and they offered a variety of subs. I had a steak sub, about 7.50 dollars, included chips and soda. The food was good but the service was terrible. Two stone face ladies who treated me as if my money wasn't good. I felt annoyed but with hunger, no point to focus on unfriendly faces. Will I go back? Maybe if hunger overrides my pride.

data.title: Sweet little hidden secret
data.text: Wonderful food in a little hide away.  I wish we had found this on our first day instead of our last. It was a great buffet of many items including salad bar and dessert bar.  Great price by the pound.  Dine in or take out, your choice.  Really delicious food as well.

data.title: Gina's is back, same location, with 7-11 next door
data.text: They reopened in a remodeled area, right next to where they were. The old location is a 7-11 now. Gina's has the same good prepared foods, and you can order from the counter. Salad bar is $6.29 a pound, hot foods are $5.29/pound. Open from 5:50 AM to 3 or 3:30 PM weekdays. They take credit cards. Eat in or carry out. Bottled and fountain drinks. I had a large salad (with big slices of grilled chicken) and some Chinese food and a coke, $10. They are located near the Courthouse and Post Office.

data.title: Gina's Cafe was closed last week,
data.text: I don't know if it is being renovated or if it changed hands. Hopefully it will reopen as a buffet place again.

data.title: Good, filling, fast, variety, buffet style
data.text: I saw this place downtown next to a Quiznos and gave it a try. It looks small from the street and it is down a few steps, but the food room is large as is the dining area.  I was very surprised by the variety. The salad bar was HUGE and the fruit was fresh and just right. You get a Styrofoam (yuck) container (2 or more sizes) or a Styrofoam plate and help yourself. Lunch is $6.29 per pound. I had roast turkey, sweet potatoes, cajun chicken, teriyaki chicken, a big biscuit, corn with carrot chunks. I wanted the roast beef, mashed potatoes/gravy but I was full after one plate. You van eat-in at formica tables, a whole room full. Drinks are fountain, with free soda refills, include the Coke and Pepsi families. The place was fairly busy at lunch time but two registers and busboys kept the line moving and tables clear. They also make some sandwiches to order. Location is on Calvert near Fayette across from the Court House/Post Office. They take credit cards but there is no Wifi. I will definitely return.
